The claim states that as of October 2017: recipients of a repair grant from Dickinson, Texas, must promise not to boycott Israel.
The expert: s verdict confirms that the city of Dickinson, Texas, requires applicants for a Hurricane Harvey Repair Grant to sign an agreement stating they will not boycott Israel during the term of the agreement.
The expert mentions that this requiremen: House Bill 89, which prohibits Texas governmental entities from contracting with companies that boycott Israel.
The expert also quotes Dickinson Mayor J: who explains that the city had to include this condition in the release of funding due to the requirement of House Bill 89, and they are simply following state law.
